title: 4K resolution, tiny cursor
body:
Title.

The cursor/pointer at 4K resolution is teeny tiny, and it's super easy to lose on the screen.  Any way to make it larger, or more vibrant?

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=sWYHl2GX,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-11T04:12:49.572+0000)
>
> This is a common issue on 4K setups. League doesn't have full support for 4K at the moment, so things like the UI and the mouse are sometimes scaled pretty small. If this occurs in game, you may be able to resolve it by setting your *windowed mode* in-game to **Full Screen** and avoid *Alt+Tabbing*, since it will often cause the UI scaling issue.
> 
> Let me know if this helped.

Unfortunately, no.  This did not help.  I found an issue similar to this posted many years ago.  I know Rito likes to say "Soon", but I feel like this is an oversight that could have been addressed.  The work around you provided also has another problem.  The game won't capture my mouse in this mode and ends up going over into my other monitors, making the game absolutely unplayable.

If you have any other suggestions though, I'm all ears.


> [{quoted}](name=Jibbur,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=sWYHl2GX,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-11T04:27:07.261+0000)

> Honestly, league looks like crap on my 4k at 1080p which has lead me to look for alternatives. I haven't found any yet, but I have reduced my spending for skins between me and my wife because I just can't enjoy it like I used to before I upgraded my system.
> 
> sucks that upgrading my system made it less enjoyable to play the game...


Yup same here.  All the particles and everything look great in 4k.  I'm more willing to try and learn how to play with a small pointer on 4k than deal with the wonky scaling from 1080p.

That usually resolves it for most players @ 4k. I feel at this point, your options are to either bring back your resolution scaling to 1080p res or continue to play at 4K resolution and adapt to the current UI scaling.

I understand this is a suboptimal situation and as an advocate for 4K resolution becoming the new standard in the future, I'm hoping League gets there sooner than later. Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

sucks that upgrading my system made it less enjoyable to play the game...

This is a common issue on 4K setups. League doesn't have full support for 4K at the moment, so things like the UI and the mouse are sometimes scaled pretty small. If this occurs in game, you may be able to resolve it by setting your *windowed mode* in-game to **Full Screen** and avoid *Alt+Tabbing*, since it will often cause the UI scaling issue.

Let me know if this helped.
Are there plans to start with 4k support? It's kind of bizarre this isn't the case yet, as most higher end gaming computers are using 4k now.

This is a pretty silly problem to have this far into 2018.    Funny, I came back to the game after a long break and through it was just me being bad and losing the cursor in a team fight.   In that time I had upgraded my hardware and monitor and now that I look at the 1080p cursor size vs the 2160p size there is a REASON I lose the cursor.

At this point it seems pretty useful to have a cursor scaling option.   That isn't even a terribly hard thing to implement in a game so it is really odd to not be implemented.   Also a higher contrast colorblind mode cursor that _really_ stands out would be great considering how many yellow impacts and sparkles are around.

Hell... as a standard nasus makes it pretty easy to hide your tiny cursor on yourself....
Found a solution. Try downloading Yolomouse. Its a good software and easy to use. Solved my cursor problem at 4k in lol. Hope you like it :)

Is Riot going to fix this at all? Or would it be okay for me to change the cursor file in the file directory for the game to something substantially larger to enjoy playing on my 55" 4k TV? 

I find it quite disappointing that this issue hasn't been taken seriously and has been pushed to the back burner for AT LEAST a year, according to this thread...
